chapter.title: Document Management
chapter.para: onCourse provides an effortless way to manage your documents. Documents can be uploaded to onCourse and linked to Courses, Classes, Enrolments, Contacts, Tutors, Students, Sites and Rooms. Because all documents are version controlled you will never lose any historic information, making RTO compliance easy.

Document management in onCourse can be used for lots of purposes:
Displaying images and other content on your website
Storing compliance documentation such as tutor resumes and qualifications
Maintaining a history of assessment and other enrolment related compliance
Distributing information to tutors through the skillOnCourse portal
Distributing assessments and course material to students

section.title: Adding new documents
section.para: You can add new documents directly in the edit view from many places in onCourse. For example below you can see a Course "Accounting with MYOB" to which we want to add a picture of a duck. Click the plus symbol above the attachments area.

caption.para: Adding an document in the Marketing tab of the edit view inside a Course

section.para: You will now be given a choice to find an existing document or upload a new file. Let's say we want to upload that duck picture from your computer. You can either click on the 'Select file...' button or drag-and-drop the file onto the box below that says 'Or drop here from desktop'.

Once a file has been selected you will notice a message at the top right of the next window saying 'Uploading to the cloud' with a percentage next to it showing you the progress. When the file has finished uploading the message will change to 'Done'
There are a number of fields when adding a new document, they are:

listitem.para: Name - Allows you to change the name of the document
'duck45.png' - In this field you can change the file name
Access - This drop down box allows to choose the access right of the document. For more information please refer to the Access rights section of this chapter.
Description - You have the ability to write a short desciption about this document

section.para: Adding a tag to this document can be done by clicking on the tag icon on the left side of the sheet.

You can also choose whether duck is allowed to be attached to other records and will appear in the clairvoyance when trying to attach an existing document. Below this there are radio buttons which let you state whether duck is attached to course ABC or whether it will get attached to all current/future classes for course ABC.

section.title: Attaching existing documents
section.para: Say you want to attach an existing document, named duck, to course ABC you can start doing this the same you have attached a new document. When on the attach document sheet, as seen below, you would start type the duck in the clairvoyance field on the left side on the sheet. A list will then appear with all existing documents in onCourse that contain duck in them.

caption.para: Attaching an existing document that is already stored in onCourse

section.para: Once you have found and selected the correct doucment a new window will appear with the following information:

listitem.para: The name of the of document, duck, will appear in the top right hand side of the page. You can find out more information on duck by clicking on the expand icon next to the name.
A short description of duck will appear below this.
Below the desciption you will be able to add tags by clicking on the tag icon.
The checkbox below this allows you to freeze course ABC to s specific version of duck, more information on freezing can be found in the freezing section of this chapter.

Below the heading 'VERSIONS' will list all the previous versions of this document along with when they were created, by whom and if they're frozen. You also have the ability to open any of these previous versions of the document by clicking the on the 'open' button.

The image of the lastest version of the document will appear on the top right hand side of the page (this can be useful to make sure you have choosen the correct duck). Below this will be the file name, format and size of the file.

The access rights of the document will also be displayed on the right sided of the page, in this case the document has been give public access, for more information on this please refer to the Access rights section of this chapter.

section.title: Editing an existing document
section.para: Once documents are managed in onCourse you can edit it properties from the Document list view.
From here you can open any of these documents or edit its details.
There are a number of fields in the general tab, they are:

listitem.para: Name - Allows you to change the name of the document
'duck45.png' - In this field you can change the file name
Access - This drop down box allows to choose the access right of the document. For more information please refer to the Access rights section of this chapter.
Description - You have the ability to write a short desciption about this document

section.para: You also have the ability to add tags and view the 12 records that are linked to duck by clicking on the symbol next to the text 'Currently attached to 12 records'. The check box below this lets you know whether this document has been allowed to be able to be attached to multiple record when created. This can't bed changed when editing an existing document.

By clicking on the 'History' tab you have the ability to view previous versions of the document 'duck' and view either the records link to them or opening a previous version of duck. You also have the ability to upload a new version of duck by clicking on the 'Upload new version' button at the bottom left side of the sheet. More information on this can be found on this in the next section Versioning.

section.title: Versioning
section.para: onCourse keeps a history of all files you upload, allowing you to link records to specific older versions and review the history of your documents at any time. This makes it easy for you to comply with ASQA auditing requirements as well as ensure you never lose an important document again.

Upload a new version of the document from the edit view shown in the previous section. You will be given the opportunity to find the file you wish to upload and replace the existing document. In this senario you are trying to upload a new version of the dcoument duck, you are then shown the following options:

listitem.para: Freeze this attachment to 8 past/completed classes or enrolments - This mean that there are 8 past/completed classes or enrolments that have been linked to the previous version of duck. If you check these boxes they will be frozen to this
Freeze this attachment to 2 current/in progress classes or enrolments
Freeze this attachment to 1 future classes or enrolments

Below these check boxes will be the total number of classes and enrolments that will be attached to the new version of duck. This number will change accordingly if some of the above boxes are checked.

caption.para: Uploading a new version of a document

section.title: Access rights
section.para:
Each document can have one of several levels of access:
Public - This gives everyone access to th document and will appear in everyones skillsonCourse portals.
Private - This means that knowone will be able to see this document and will only be able to be used within onCourse
Tutors and enrolled students - Both Tutor and enrolled students are linked to the attachment are able to view this document and will appear in both their skillsonCourse portals.
Tutors only - This means only the tutors that are linked to the attachment are able to view this document and will appear in their skillsonCourse portals.
